title: How to Make Turkey Wraps

steps.headline: Slice leftover turkey if you're not purchasing pre-sliced deli meat.
steps.description: Use a sharp serrated knife to cut your turkey into slices as thin as possible—ideally the width of your knife's blade. When you're slicing, move the knife back forth using a minimal amount of pressure and let it do most of the work for you. For the best results, refrigerate your turkey overnight after cooking it and prior to slicing it.

steps.headline: Dice your tomato.
steps.description: Start by washing your tomato in cold water and remove any stickers from it. Now, use a sharp straight-edged or serrated kitchen knife to cut it into slices of the same thickness. Afterward, either stack the slices on top of one another or align them next to each other and cut them into strips. Finally, cut the strips into equally sized dice. Cut the initial slices close together for small diced tomatoes and farther apart for thicker dices. Hold the knife steady from the top using your non-dominant hand.

steps.headline: Shred your Swiss cheese if it isn't already.
steps.description: If you didn't purchase pre-shredded Swiss cheese, get out your grater and cutting board. Hold your grater at a 45-degree angle to the board and start swiping the cheese gently across the grater in up and down motions. Afterward, tap the metal end of the grater against the edge of your cutting board to remove the excess trimmings. Hold the cheese firmly and exercise caution so you don't cut yourself.

steps.headline: Slice 1 large avocado.
steps.description: Start by using a sharp knife to cut around the avocado. Afterward, remove the 2 halves and pop out the seed. Now, place each piece horizontally in front of you and create smooth, straight vertical lines down the avocado. When you're done, scoop each slice out with a spoon. Be gentle with your slices—avocados are easy to squish. Keep the slices the same thickness—about ⁄4 inch (0.64 cm) is ideal.

steps.headline: Mix together Dijon mustard and cream cheese.
steps.description: Add 2 tablespoons (30 grams) of Dijon mustard and one 8 ounce (230 g) package of cream cheese with chives into a small bowl. Now, mix it together with a spoon until it’s a smooth consistency. Use plain cream cheese if you're not a fan of chives.

steps.headline: Chop your 6 slices of bacon into a crumble.
steps.description: Lay down all your pieces of bacon onto a cutting board lined with paper towel. Keep each piece horizontal and parallel to each other. Start making vertical cuts down your bacon slices and continue until you have small pieces. Now, continue chopping these bits into pieces until they're as small as you'd like. Use a stick blender to make even smaller pieces of bacon. Purchase a bag of bacon bits to skip this step.

steps.headline: Spread 2 tablespoons (30 grams) of the cream cheese mixture onto each tortilla.
steps.description: Use a butter knife to spread the mixture smoothly across the tortillas. Be sure to stop about ⁄4 inch (0.64 cm) from the edge of each one. Make sure that the mixture is an even thickness across the tortillas.

steps.headline: Pour 1.5 cups (82.5 grams) of shredded lettuce onto each tortilla.
steps.description: Spread the lettuce pieces around the tortilla so that they're an even thickness. Afterward, gently press down on your lettuce so that each piece blends with your cream cheese mixture. If your lettuce pieces are too big after pouring them onto the tortillas, put them onto a cutting board and chop them into smaller pieces.

steps.headline: Add turkey slices and Swiss cheese on top of your lettuce.
steps.description: After adding your lettuce, place 2 slices of turkey onto each tortilla. Now, sprinkle ¾ cup (75 grams) of shredded Swiss cheese evenly across all of your slices. Use your fingers to spread the Swiss cheese evenly after pouring it.

steps.headline: Top your tortillas with crumbled bacon, tomato, and avocado slices.
steps.description: Layer your tomato and avocado slices over your tortillas evenly. Afterward, sprinkle your bacon over the slices as evenly as possible.

steps.headline: Roll and cut your turkey wraps.
steps.description: Start rolling your wraps and take care to keep all of the toppings as tight to the side of the wraps as possible. After rolling them, make a diagonal cut down each. After rolling the wraps, rotate them so their fold is on the bottom and gently press down on each to help them stay together.

steps.headline: Serve your wraps with your choice of sides.
steps.description: Sliced vegetables, such as carrots, cucumbers, onions, and tomatoes, are a great choice. You can also pair them with your favorite dips, such as spinach-ricotta, hummus, and even guacamole if you're a fan of some extra avocado. Try serving your wraps with chicken soup, ginger miso soup, quinoa salad, or coleslaw.
